title: Selective Memory Amplification
description: Detects when certain narratives or memories are disproportionately amplified to overshadow or drown out other perspectives, creating a skewed historical record rather than a balanced one.
indicators: Overemphasis on specific events or figures to the exclusion of others
Patterns of repetitive highlighting of certain memories to overshadow diverse narratives
Use of amplification as a form of erasure of less dominant histories
